gw.cc.financials.check.entity

Interface CheckRecurrence

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    MonthlyCheckRecurrence, WeeklyCheckRecurrence

    public interface CheckRecurrence
    CheckRecurrence Describes the recurrence schedule for a check.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void adjustDatesBasedOnIssuanceDateOffsetAndBusinessCalendar(java.util.Date[] dates, CheckSet checkSet)
      Depending on whether or not checks should be issued early, adjust the recurrence dates.
      java.util.Date calculateFirstRecurrenceDateBasedOnRecurrence()
      Calculates what should be the first date of the recurrence based on the recurrence values.
      void calculateSubsequentDatesBasedOnRecurrence(java.util.Date[] dates, int startingIndex)
      Starting at startingIndex, calculates and populates the subsequent recurrence dates based on the recurrence values This method also does not take into account the 'Issue Early' value.
      CheckRecurrence cloneRecurrence(CheckSet newCheckSet)
      Creates a clone of this CheckRecurrence, either weekly or monthly as appropriate.
      Check[] getChecksSortedByDate()
      Returns the checks in this recurrence, sorted by date.
      java.lang.String getDescription()
      Returns a description of this recurrence.
      Check getFirstEditableCheck()
      Returns the first editable check in this recurrence.
      java.util.Date[] getRecurrenceDates()
      Calculates the dates on which the checks in this recurrence should be sent.
      CurrencyAmount getTotal()
      The sum total of the net amounts of each of the checks in the recurrence.
      CurrencyAmountPair getTotalPair()
      Gets the total amount in the transaction currency paired with the amount in the reserving currency.
      boolean hasEditableChecks()
      Tests whether this recurrence contains any checks that are still editable.

    • Method Detail

      • getChecksSortedByDate

        Check[] getChecksSortedByDate()
        Returns the checks in this recurrence, sorted by date.

      • getDescription

        java.lang.String getDescription()
        Returns a description of this recurrence.

      • getRecurrenceDates

        java.util.Date[] getRecurrenceDates()
        Calculates the dates on which the checks in this recurrence should be sent.

      • getTotal

        CurrencyAmount getTotal()
        The sum total of the net amounts of each of the checks in the recurrence.

        Warning: if there are no checks in the recurrence, this method returns a CurrencyAmount with 0 and null currency (dangerous to pass into "Strict" methods).

      • getTotalPair

        CurrencyAmountPair getTotalPair()
        Gets the total amount in the transaction currency paired with the amount in the reserving currency.
        See Also:
        getTotal()

      • hasEditableChecks

        boolean hasEditableChecks()
        Tests whether this recurrence contains any checks that are still editable.

        Note: For efficiency when dealing with large recurrences, if this bean is not new, this method performs a query against the database. If you aren't worried about loading large recurrences into the bundle, you can determine whether there are editable checks on a recurrence against the bundle by evaluating EditableChecks and testing the length of the result.

        Returns:
        true if the recurrence contains at least one editable check, else false

      • cloneRecurrence

        CheckRecurrence cloneRecurrence(CheckSet newCheckSet)
        Creates a clone of this CheckRecurrence, either weekly or monthly as appropriate. In either case copies in critical base values, and also sets firstDueDate to next date in recurrence (After last occurrence date of recurrence being copied). If cloned check/checkgroup has exposure with service period, this method also generates the proper service period for the new check(s).

      • calculateFirstRecurrenceDateBasedOnRecurrence

        java.util.Date calculateFirstRecurrenceDateBasedOnRecurrence()
        Calculates what should be the first date of the recurrence based on the recurrence values. This does not take into account the 'Issue Early' value.

      • calculateSubsequentDatesBasedOnRecurrence

        void calculateSubsequentDatesBasedOnRecurrence(java.util.Date[] dates,
                                               int startingIndex)
        Starting at startingIndex, calculates and populates the subsequent recurrence dates based on the recurrence values This method also does not take into account the 'Issue Early' value.

      • adjustDatesBasedOnIssuanceDateOffsetAndBusinessCalendar

        void adjustDatesBasedOnIssuanceDateOffsetAndBusinessCalendar(java.util.Date[] dates,
                                                             CheckSet checkSet)
        Depending on whether or not checks should be issued early, adjust the recurrence dates. Also ensures that no date is before today's date.

      • getFirstEditableCheck

        Check getFirstEditableCheck()
        Returns the first editable check in this recurrence. In some cases the earliest check is not editable even though the overall recurrence is editable. This provides the UI with the most appropriate check for modification.
        Returns:
        The first check in this recurrence (by ScheduledSendDate) for which isEditable() returns TRUE
